byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed reported from Guatemala City, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City. Nic Wirtz contributed reporting from Guatemala City.
byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and ELISABETH MALKIN

abstract: Pres Otto Perez Molina of Guatemala, within hours of submitting his resignation in the face of mounting corruption accusations, is jailed pending conclusion of investigation into his role in multimillion-dollar customs fraud case; jailing of Perez Molina sends tremors through country and region, and underscores political strength of protesters who took to streets for months demanding ouster and prosecution of corrupt leader in country historically marked by dictatorship and violent repression.
lead_paragraph: The decision to detain Mr. Pérez Molina is unprecedented in Guatemalan history and was a stunning conclusion to a day of swift change in the nation.

headline.main: Otto Pérez Molina of Guatemala Is Jailed Hours After Resigning Presidency
headline.print_headline: Guatemala Leader Resigns and Is Swiftly Jailed

snippet: The decision to detain Mr. Pérez Molina is unprecedented in Guatemalan history and was a stunning conclusion to a day of swift change in the nation.
